citation.article-title: Alkalibaculum bacchi gen. nov., sp. nov., a CO-oxidizing, ethanol-producing acetogen isolated from livestock-impacted soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Alkalibaculum bacchi sp. nov.
Alkalibaculum bacchi (bac′chi. L. gen. n. bacchi of Bacchus, Roman god of wine, referring to the production of ethanol by this organism).
Cells are 1.5–2.2 μm in length and 0.5–0.8 μm wide.
Growth occurs between 15 °C and 40 °C; some strains grow at 45 °C (optimum temperature is 37 °C).
No growth occurs at 4 °C or at 50 °C.
All strains grow at pH 6.5–10.5; optimum is 8.0–8.5.
Starch, aesculin, gelatin and casein are not hydrolysed.
Sulfate or nitrate is not reduced.
Cellulose and agar are not degraded.
The end products of glucose fermentation are acetate with trace amounts of ethanol and CO2.
Vitamins are required for growth; yeast extract greatly stimulates growth.
H2 : CO2, CO : CO2, glucose, fructose, mannose, turanose, ribose, trimethylamine, pyruvate, methanol, ethanol, n-propanol and n-butanol are used as growth substrates.

Arabinose, galactose, trehalose, raffinose, melibiose, sucrose, maltose, lactose, melezitose, fucose, xylose, cellobiose, glycerol, dulcitol, mannitol, malonic acid, glycolic acid, salicin, amygdalin, choline, betaine, methylamine, dimethylamine, DMSO, adonitol, inositol, aesculin, gum arabic, formate, acetate, propionate, butyrate, lactate, fumarate, 2-butanol, 2-propanol, hexanol, anisic acid, 3-methoxyphenol, 3-methoxycinnamic acid, 4-methoxysalicylic acid, 5-methoxysalicylic acid, syringic acid, peptone, tryptone, Casamino acids and yeast extract are not utilized.
Using the API Rapid ID 32A kit, a weak reaction is observed only for glutamic acid decarboxylase.

No activity is detected for urease, arginine dihydrolase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-galactosidase 6-phosphate, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, α-arabinosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-fucosidase, alkaline phosphatase, arginine arylamidase, proline arylamidase, leucyl glycine arylamidase, phenylalanine arylamidase, leucine arylamidase, pyroglutamic acid arylamidase, tyrosine arylamidase, alanine arylamidase, glycine arylamidase, histidine arylamidase, glutamyl glutamic acid arylamidase or serine arylamidase.
Additionally from the API Rapid ID 32A, mannose and raffinose are not fermented, indole is not produced and nitrate is not reduced.

Using the API ZYM kit, enzyme activity is detected only for esterase (C4) (weak reaction), with some strains indicating very weak activity for naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase (CP11T and CP13) and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase (CP13 and CP15).

Enzyme activity is not detected for alkaline phosphatase, esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase or α-fucosidase.
Approximately 29 % of the total fatty acids contain dimethyl acetal moieties.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA is 34 mol%.
The type strain, CP11T (=ATCC BAA-1772T=DSM 22112T), was isolated from livestock-impacted soil.
